project.teaser: """CONNECTINGHEALTH - CONNECTing the dots withIN diGItal HEALTH Innovation Ecosystems"" is a two-year preparatory action for setting up joint programme among the actors of the digital health ecosystems in Europe and beyond. The overall aim of the project is fully aligned with...
project.objective: """CONNECTINGHEALTH - CONNECTing the dots withIN diGItal HEALTH Innovation Ecosystems"" is a two-year preparatory action for setting up joint programme among the actors of the digital health ecosystems in Europe and beyond. The overall aim of the project is fully aligned with the call for proposals, which is to foster interconnected, inclusive innovation ecosystems across Europe and maximising the value of innovation in one of the sectors that provides the future opportunities for growth and increased competitiveness and innovativeness, namely the digital health. CONNECTINGHEALTH will be implemented by the small and agile core group, which consists of the European Connected Health Alliance as a European partner and three organisations that are leaders of the digital health ecosystems in their regions: Scotland, Western Hungary and Southern Ostrobothnia. To reach its goals, CONNECTINGHEALTH will conduct the mapping of the digital health ecosystems in Europe, their initiatives, projects, resources and stakeholders, develop the future scenario for the digital health sector in Europe 2030 and identify the preferable future that will be the base for the multi-year action plan, co-designed together with the stakeholders and ecosystems engaged in the project through the futures and investigative workshops. Besides the investigation on the general level of the digital health, the project will look deeper into the three topic crucial for the further development of the digital health sector in Europe, namely: 1/ health for wealth opportunities, 2/ opportunities of the transition from traditional to digital health industry and 3/ opportunities of engaging the stakeholders from health and social sector in the development and implementation of the solutions. CONNECTINGHEALTH will result with the multi-year action plan and the number of immediately exploitable results, eg. the future scenarios and the focus area papers. They will be disseminated widely to the key stakeholders."
project.title: CONNECTing the dots withIN diGItal HEALTH Innovation Ecosystems
project.keywords: digital health, innovation ecosystems, thematic innovation ecosystems, growth and competitiveness, health for wealth

result.title: Map of the digital health ecosystems in Europe and beyond
Periodic Reporting for period 2 - CONNECTINGHEALTH (CONNECTing the dots withIN diGItal HEALTH Innovation Ecosystems)
result.teaser: The COVID-19 pandemic has dramatically transformed the world and the field of healthcare, and brought more pressure on the European countries and companies to develop and implement cutting-edge domestic health technologies. To succeed, collaboration, innovation, and investment...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: CONNECTINGHEALTH Impact Plan and Report (M6)
result.description: The first iteration of the document due in M6 will outline the communication and dissemination activities to be undertaken in order to ensure the visibility impact and sustainability of the project

result.title: Report on the engagement of stakeholders and ecosystems
Data Management Plan (M6)
result.description: The Data Management Plan DMP will address the relevant aspects of making data collected and processed in CONNECTINGHEALTH findableaccessible interoperable and reusable Data safety and security aspects will be addressed in the DMP

result.title: CONNECTINGHEALTH Impact Plan and Report (M24)
result.description: The second version of the CONNECTINGHEALTH Impact plan and report (due at M24) will report on the activities and their impact.

result.title: Report on the three focus areas
result.description: Report on the opportunities in the selected three focus areas Health for Wealth From traditional to digital health industry and Supporting health and social care stakeholders in promoting and adopting digitalisation and new technologies in health and social care services

result.title: Paper: lessons learned from other domains of health
Data Management Plan (M24)
result.description: The (final) Data Management Plan (DMP) will address the relevant aspects of making data collected and processed in CONNECTINGHEALTH findable,accessible, interoperable and re-usable, as well as the data safety and security

result.title: Scenarios for the digital health sector in 2030
Paper: Lessons learned from the three focus area
result.description: The deliverable will identify collect and evaluate the key lessons learnt from the three focus areas and generalise them towards the European ecosystems and the multiyear action plan

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
